file_content.text: No authority but your own, no obligation but to yourself. Do not be afraid. Admit how good it feels.
Grandmaster Satele is the heart of the Jedi Order. I would never strike her down.
No. I feel sick.
You refuse to admit your truth. So be it.
Grandmaster Satele failed the Jedi Order. I should have struck her down long ago.
Yes, this feels right.
You are ready for the future.
The corrupted patriot. In the end, victory was more important to her than the people she served.
No. She made hard decisions, but she cared about her people.
You didn't know her.
Still playing the lap dog? So be it.
You have no idea how long I've wanted to do that.
She deserved to die.
You are no longer bound by orders. The future is yours to decide.
You do not belong to the Republic any more than he did. You have always lived outside the law.
What's a dead man got to do with this?
What's your point?
The galaxy is shaped by the dead. You must learn from their failures.
You're right. But I don't belong to you either.
I belong to no one but myself.
When it comes to your future, your will is law. Not mine.
These visions... are they real? Will Coruscant fall?
Am I seeing the future?
What does it matter?
Did it please you to kill him yourself? I sensed you felt cheated when I disposed of him.
Wrong. I respected Marr. He led the Empire with honor.
He deserved to live.
There is no honor in fighting for a lost cause.
Marr was weak. I always knew he'd die for my pleasure someday.
It's true, I did.
You have released your past. You are ready.
The great Mandalore. Just another obstacle in your path to be swept aside.
The Pubs put a fortune on the top Mando's head. Too bad this is a dream.
I wish it was really him.
You joke of credits and ignore the truth of your own power.
I'm good, but it'd take more than just me to drop Mandalore.
The real Mandalore is tougher.
False modesty has no place here. If you wish to survive, own your power.
Darth Jadus. The best Sith my Empire ever produced, but still deeply flawed--and no match for you.
Your appeals to my ego are tedious. That isn't the real Jadus.
Spare me your false flattery.
You must see beyond your limited perception.
Fanatics are led by their egos. I always knew Jadus would follow his straight into my crosshair.
He never was.
You claim your power. You are close, now.
This dream is a big joke to you, isn't it?
You're enjoying all this.
I seek only to open your eyes.
He was an honorable warrior. Something you wouldn't understand.
I admired him.
He was a glorified thug. You must aspire to be more.
